predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing PMI (headline, SA) for October 2025 will print between 49.0 and 51.5 in ISM’s release due by 2025-11-01.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the headline PMI value in ISM’s official October 2025 Manufacturing ISM Report On Business. Outcome is true if the reported PMI is within [49.0, 51.5], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global US Manufacturing PMI (flash/final)
Philadelphia Fed and Empire State manufacturing surveys
Durable goods orders ex-transportation
ISM supplier deliveries, inventories, and new orders subindices
predictions.rationale: Regional surveys and soft-landing dynamics suggest mildly contractionary-to-flat factory activity.

predictions.text: Euro area HCOB Services PMI (final) for October 2025 will print between 49.0 and 51.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the final October 2025 euro area Services PMI published by S&P Global/HCOB. Outcome is true if the final index is within [49.0, 51.0], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: HCOB services PMI flash vs. revisions
Euro area consumer confidence and retail sales
Energy prices (Brent, TTF) affecting service costs
Tourism indicators and mobility data
predictions.rationale: Growth is soft but stabilizing; services likely hover near breakeven.

predictions.text: China Industrial Production (YoY) for October 2025 will print between 4.8% and 6.2% in the NBS release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the October 2025 industrial production YoY growth rate in the National Bureau of Statistics of China official release. Outcome is true if within [4.8%, 6.2%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Electricity generation and freight volume
Export orders (Customs data) and PMI new orders
Credit impulse and infrastructure investment
Semiconductor and electronics output trends
predictions.rationale: Manufacturing remains supported by infrastructure and exports but capped by property drag.

predictions.text: U.S. Unemployment rate (U-3, SA) for October 2025 will print between 4.1% and 4.3% in the BLS release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the seasonally adjusted U-3 unemployment rate in the October 2025 Employment Situation report (BLS). Outcome is true if within [4.1%, 4.3%], inclusive.
monitoring_signals: Initial and continuing jobless claims
Household survey employment vs. payrolls
Labor force participation rate
JOLTS openings and quits
predictions.rationale: Gradual labor-market cooling with still-solid employment should keep jobless rate near recent range.

predictions.text: Nikkei 225 (ticker: ^N225) will close at or above 42,000.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify using a reputable data source (e.g., Yahoo Finance or exchange data) that the official daily close of ^N225 is ≥ 42,000.0 on any trading day through 2025-11-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: USD/JPY levels and BOJ policy guidance
Earnings season surprises for TOPIX heavyweights
Global risk appetite and U.S. tech leadership
Domestic fiscal policy developments
predictions.rationale: Policy continuity and weak yen support equities; momentum near records increases the chance of a new high.

predictions.text: USD/CNH (Yahoo Finance: CNH=X) will trade at or above 7.50 on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify intraday high on Yahoo Finance CNH=X (or equivalent reputable source) shows a trade ≥ 7.50 by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Daily PBOC USD/CNY fixing vs. models
Capital flows and offshore-onshore spread
China growth data and policy easing
Broad USD trend (DXY)
predictions.rationale: Soft Chinese growth, accommodative policy, and firm USD risk a push toward 7.50.

predictions.text: NYMEX WTI crude oil front-month futures (CL) will settle at or below $74.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify CME Group daily settlement price for the front-month CL contract is ≤ $74.00 on any trading day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: EIA crude inventory changes and Cushing stocks
OPEC+ guidance and compliance
Global demand indicators (mobility, PMIs)
Geopolitical risk premium in Middle East/Russia
predictions.rationale: High inventories and demand risks may puncture prices despite intermittent geopolitical premiums.

predictions.text: LME Copper 3-month will settle at or above $9,500 per metric ton on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the official LME 3M copper cash/PM settlement is ≥ $9,500/mt on any trading day through 2025-11-30 using LME data or reputable terminals.
monitoring_signals: China industrial activity and grid investment
Mine supply disruptions and TC/RCs
Dollar index (DXY) and rates
Inventory levels at LME/SHFE
predictions.rationale: Tight longer-term fundamentals with episodic macro risk-on spurts can lift copper above $9.5k.

predictions.text: The Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or below 13.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the official VIX close from Cboe (or Yahoo Finance ^VIX) is ≤ 13.00 on any trading day through 2025-11-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: S&P 500 realized volatility (20D)
Earnings season dispersion and macro data shocks
Dealer gamma positioning and options skew
Fed communications and term premium moves
predictions.rationale: Megacap-led rallies can compress implied vol episodically, even amid macro crosscurrents.

predictions.text: Ethereum (ETH-USD) will trade at or above $3,800 on at least one UTC day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify using a reputable aggregator (e.g., Yahoo Finance ETH-USD) that the intraday high reaches ≥ $3,800 on any UTC day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: BTC dominance and crypto market breadth
Risk appetite in equities and rates moves
Spot ETF flows and staking/validator metrics
On-chain activity and gas fees
predictions.rationale: Risk-on stretches and crypto-specific catalysts can drive episodic ETH spikes.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, NASA will publish a solicitation (draft RFP or final) on SAM.gov to reopen competition for an Artemis lunar Human Landing System provider.
predictions.verification_criteria: True if SAM.gov lists a NASA-issued draft or final solicitation referencing the lunar Human Landing System (HLS) or equivalent Artemis lander competition dated on/before 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: NASA press releases and procurement notices
Industry day announcements for HLS
Congressional hearings or budget directives
Competitive responses from aerospace primes
predictions.rationale: NASA stated intent to reopen lander contracts; a near-term procurement notice is likely.

predictions.text: Lynas Rare Earths (ASX: LYC) will close at or above A$9.50 on at least one ASX trading day by 2025-11-30 (local exchange time).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via official ASX closing prices or a reputable data source that LYC.AX closes ≥ A$9.50 on any trading day through 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Policy developments on U.S.–Australia critical minerals funding
NdPr and rare earth oxide spot prices
Lynas production/expansion updates
AUD/USD and broader materials sector moves
predictions.rationale: New funding pipeline and strategic alignment support sentiment and potential re-rating for rare earth producers.
